intro: Uncinia hamata f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hookweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to brownish flowers, typical of the sedge family. It is often found in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Its fibrous root system helps stabilize soil, making it an important species in wetland ecosystems.
